newsitem.title: UK: Esso Dutch refinery back to full capacity next wee.
newsitem.headline: Esso Dutch refinery back to full capacity next wee.

text.p: Exxon's Esso Netherlands' refinery in Rotterdam will get back to full operating capacity sometime next week, a company spokesman said on Thursday.
The refinery was in the process of starting up after a power outage in the Rotterdam area at 0730 GMT on Tuesday, lasting 90 minutes, forced it's closure.
The spokesman said it was too early to say on what day next week full capacity would be reached.
The crude distillation unit, reformer and hydrogen plant had all resumed operations and other units were being brought back on stream today, he said.
"Some units are back already and we are following normal start-up procedures," he said. Refineries usually re-start by bringing processing units back on-stream in sequence.
The Esso plant has a capacity to process 175,000 barrels per day.
